Description: One irregular fragment of a brown woven goat hair bag decorated with a fringe of goat hair wrapped at intervals with blue, green, red, yellow and gold wool. The goat hair thread is 'z'-plied and the wrapping wool is 's'-spun. The weave is weft-faced at the top of the fragment and warp-faced at the edge of the fringed area. The fringe is twisted. The stitch gauge is warp 8 per 10mm and weft 8 per 10mm. The top 20mm of the top edge consist of 6 rows of countered twining. This is followed by 50mm of basketweave. Below this the warps hang loosely and are of irregular length. The longest is 310mm. At intervals each warp pair has been wrapped with coloured wool, (red, blue, green, yellow, cream, purple, burgundy and brown) in a figure '8' configuration. Wrapped areas are 10-15mm in size.
Bibliographic references: Adams & Adams 1998 / Kulubnarti II, The Artifactual Remains (p. 62, 122, pl. 8.1E)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 85.2.92 (excavation object cat. no.)
